review: What can I say? It's a Red Robin - yummy. I haven't been in ages but I always get the Whiskey River Wrap (I LOVE wraps!), I paired that with a martini with a splash of cranberry juice! Lovely staff and service, we were there pretty early in the afternoon so there wasn't much of a crowd. Gotta love the bottomless fries!
Usually great service. We let them know when we area in a rush and they have always been prompt. Only bad thing we ever had was the soup.

It's a Red Robin so you've probably eaten at one before.  In summary, the food was typical, the service friendly, and attentive, though not exceptionally note worthy.  Red Robin is one of those restaurants that you either love or hate, and I'm putting check marks in both categories.  If you're looking for a decent burger for a fair price, you could do a lot worse.  Glowing recommendation?  Not really, but it is what it is.

We've been to Red Robins all over the country.  Yum!  This particular one has great servers.  They offer to get the starving kiddos some fries before we order, they have been so good about making families feel at home, and they'll even replace a balloon if it gets away!

This Red Robin is pretty typical of all the locations that I've eaten at over the years.  The burger and salad we had were quite good, as were the sweet potato fries and the fresh brewed ice tea.  Service was just fine too.  With a Red Robin the food is usually pretty consistent and this location lived up to that - decent food at a reasonable price and that's the way it's been for 40+ years in my opinion.  I look forward to my next visit.

I've eaten and several Red Robins over the years -- and this one was the worst of the bunch.  Imagine you order a hamburger.  Without visually inspecting it (who does that?) I didn't know the patty had broken into three pieces.  I picked it up and a hunk of patty went through the paper wrapper and straight onto my shirt.  Bleh!  The service was OK, but the food didn't taste nearly as good as the other Red Robins I've been to.  If I'm this way again, I'd skip this place.

My friend & I recently went in here to have burgers for lunch....I must say this is the BEST Red Robin I've been to. It was extremely busy so we sat at the bar. Despite the volume of people here the bartender was very good - he was thorough & friendly. I will definitely come back!

I generally enjoy red robin, however upon eating here a couple weeks ago we received horrible service from our server, we order an appetizer mozzarella sticks and it was served with our entrée intead of an appetizer, than the some of mozzarella sticks had no cheese in them, our server never refilled our drinks and finally I asked a bus person to get the manager as we literally only seen our server 3 times during our entire experience. When the manager finally came to our table we told him of our experience and he promptly refilled our drinks and gave us our mozzarella sticks at no charge. We will not be revisiting this location

This is the worst Red Robin restaurant I have ever been to. Three times I came here to eat their burgers and three times I have left disappointed and feeling sick afterwards. The wait staff is too busy talking among themselves to actually do their job. I had to walk over to the bar and get my cup refilled because the waitress kept "forgetting" about it. I have been to many Red Robin restaurant and this is the worst by far. Stay away if you can help it. If you are looking for great burgers in the area, The RAM just opened up down the street near the movie theater. Go there for a quality burger.

This Red Robin must fly under the franchise management. The bar was a mess, bartender had a slice of pizza and an energy drink out and eating it at the bar. A manager was upset over a to-go order mess-up and was discussing the issue very loudly with the responsible employee. The discussion went on for about 25 minutes. It was a cluster.  On the positive, a very helpful Waittress picked up the pieces, got us drinks and took our order. There are so many other options, including other Red Robins along the I-5, I will not be back.

I love burgers. It's the to-go food for every American, yet I usually don't order burgers at Red Robin. Up until recently, all I would ever order from Red Robin is the Buzzard Wings, and of course, their Fickle Lemonade. With the new addition of their Red Tavern Burger, I find myself ordering burgers again. Truth be told, the other burgers they offer are just too big for me to finish, but the portion size of their Red Tavern Burger is just right. With the addition of a strawberry milkshake and extra crispy fries, Red Robin provides that retro atmosphere with their saturated vintage art decor, bright lights, large booths, and red sticky seats. What more can you expect?

Didnt have to wait long. Server wasnt too nosey but checked often enough that we enjoyed our food, and he was funny. Prices were good. My hubby didnt get the food that he ordered though - so some other guy got his burger! We didnt bother to say anything cuz we didnt want the food wasted, so obviously it wasnt a big deal.  I'd go back.
It's a typical Red Robin but this one tends to be a bit busier than other ones for dinner.

This was my third visit here. Last two visits were good that I came back again. As usual, I went to my favorite table in the bar area. My waitress was nice at first but after bringing out my food, she never came back to my table again to check on my burger or anything. My fries didn't get refilled. She walked by a couple of times but never stopped and asked if I needed anything. She simply brought my check after I was done. I was a little disappointed.

Went for lunch last week.  The place was empty when we arrived (11:00) and full when we left, so get there early for lunch!  I had a chicken Caesar wrap. It was the same as you get at any other red robin. Less lettuce than others which was good for me. The tortilla was super tough which means that it was probably microwaved. Made it difficult to chew through without all the innards of the wrap spooging out. :(. I asked for a side of caesar so I could dip my wrap if I wanted. When the food was delivered no side was included so I asked the waitress. She said she had the cooks put extra in my wrap.  ???  Why?  That's not what I asked for.  One of my companions got the chop burger. The bun fell apart, the meat fell apart and he was resigned to eat it with a knife and fork. My other companion has a BLT croissant and had no complaints. Waitress was attentive. Checked back often.  As good as can be expected from a chain.

We had like 3 servers trying to take our orders... And they didn't even bring us water when we got seated. We waited for like 20 minutes for our water... Then finally someone came and asked us what we would like to drink. We waited another 20 minutes for our drink... But since we waited to order our foods, we also ordered along with the drinks. The onion rings were delicious, my Teriyaki Chicken sandwich was delicious. The last person that served us was friendlier than the last servers. I understand it was busy, but Red Robins in Northgate mall are always busy, but they know how to organize well. I'm not going back to the Red Robin in Federal Way anymore.

Always a huge wait on busy nights. Service is fast only on slow days. When it is busy, service is slow and waiter keeps coming back to the table while eating, almost like they were trying to rush us out of there. Food was pretty good but drinks sucked. Overall it was just a so-so experience.

Sean was a great server. Very accommodating but not overly.  Our food was delicious the kids always love to come to red robin it's a treat for us all! Kids cups with lids are genius! And the kids meals are very reasonable in price too!! We go to this Red Robin frequently, hey... its a kid favorite!  We've also been served by Angeli and Denise. Both really great! and super accommodating! Denise, reminded the girls of a grandma type always making sure everyone was fed and happy. We just love it! A little loud but they keep the food coming pretty quickly. Most of the time the appetizers come within seconds of the main meal so you have a lot in front of you at the same time. But I love and live off appetizers, so we just snack on everything the whole time!

This Red Robin location can be hit or miss.  I think often the kitchen works faster than the waitstaff.   I don't see what's so difficult about getting and apps, then waiting a bit, then a salad or soup, if ordered, and, finally, entrees.   I can't understand how any waitperson would let things come out pretty much within moments of each other.  It's happened many times.  If we order apps and then wait to order entrees, the waitperson is hovering and constantly asking for our order. We've had times the fries are cold in the middle.  Not lukewarm, more like been in the freezer and cooked fast but not through, cold.

My husband loves hamburgers and my kids love Red Robin, I however am not a fan. With that said Red Robin has been a place we go about once a month or so. Lately the Federal Way Red Robin has turned out less than satisfactory food (my husband no longers enjoys it) and the service is awful. The last two times we have gone large parties were the priority and our table of 5 has been ignored. My rule there is if you don't have your drinks within 5 minutes of being seated get ready for a long wait on your food too. If you live in the Federal Way area its worth the drive to the Auburn Supermall to go to the Red Robin there.

Margaritas were great! My fiancee also enjoyed his blue ribbon burger. Unfortunately my sweet potato fries were clearly old (soggy, no flavor). French dip was ok - meat was flavored well but also tasted a bit old and the bread wasn't toasted so no flavor and didn't hold up when dipped in the au jus (the whole point of a french dip!).
Reliable, good burgers every time. You can't beat Red's Tavern Double for $6.99.

I honestly didn't expect a lot when our party of 7 (including 4 kids) showed up early Saturday evening for dinner at Red Robin.  I couldn't have been more surprised - pleasantly I might add.  It took a little while to get us seated, but once seated, the service was outstanding.  Our server couldn't have been much out of high school if that.  But his customer service was top notch.  With 4 kids, you can't help but be a little high maintenance and he was more than happy to meet our every need with a smile and pleasant manner. The food was also outstanding.  I had the Teriyaki Chicken Sandwich with cole slaw.  I love how you can substitute a salad or cole slaw instead of fries for no extra charge.  The fries are also unlimited - they bring you small portions (which is great); and if you want more just ask - they promptly bring you more fresh, hot fries.  The margarita's were good too - more than just a mix, they did pack a punch! I don't know if all Red Robin's are this good, but this one really knows how to give great service, great food - and all on a very busy Saturday evening.  I was very impressed and I don't impress easily.  Great place for a family with kids - or without kids!
It is ok for a chain restraunt. If you want good burgers go to Burger Express in Federal Way! It is THE BEST and NO ONE can beat them!

I had lunch here today with a friend.  We had a great experience.  I would actually say our waiter Parker was the best waiter I've ever had the pleasure of being served by. He was very attentive & funny. We even spoke to the management about this young man. He made our day.  The food was great also. RR has always been a favorite of mine. On a $43 dollar bill we tipped him $15 because he simply made our experience fabulous.
Good food and service. Quite possibly the only restaurant in Federal Way where you can get good service.

Overrated food. Gives me the bubble guts every time I (used) to go there. Will never go there again. It's shit food with horrible service. Especially in the bar. They suck. Good thing we have other options round these parts.

Well I was pleasantly surprised when I asked for my burger to be served on a plate instead of the normal baskets. I hated to eat from those pesky baskets so thumbs up red Robin.  Good jod. I had the chicken teriyaki burger and all was very good.

Nice location and pretty reliable food. I know what to expect when coming here and its always a nice option when the wife and I can't decide on what to eat.  I think this is one of the better chain restaurants in Federal Way and they are consistent in keeping the food and service good. We have gone here during all different hours of the day and even when its super packed, we usually can get a seat relatively fast.  It really is a good option if you are shopping at the mall and don't feel like eating typical mall food, for sure makes it worth it to head across the parking lot.

Drivin to Alaska waiter forgot us not to busy, someone else after an hour brought us very cold food that had been up in the window a while, the bathrooms were blown bad.  Usually go to Red Robins but not anymore..

I am a regular here, and I have NEVER received such poor service from Red Robbins. We had a group of about 9 on a Sunday night.  I expected a little bit of a wait but this was horrible... Our waiter was not rude or anything just un attentive and extremely slow.  Here's the break down:  Walked in at 8pm. We got seated within 10 minutes but it was about another 20 minutes after we sat down before Bill came over to say hello for the first time and take our drink orders.  We asked if we could just make our orders as we had plenty of time to think about it.  30 minutes later.. Still no appetizers, food, drinks or even water for that matter! Had to go chase down a hostess and ask why it was taking so long. Couple minutes later, drinks and fries we asked for... Which were cold and pitiful. Imagine five fries per basket... Who does that?!  15 min later... Our food comes out: Mind you, that's over an hour since we sat down to get our food.  The burgers which were ordered "no pink" medium came out burnt.  Which I just don't feel comfortable sending food back.  I had to flag him down for refreshment refills several times. I like RR... I'm a long time royal member. This was unusual.  But regardless incredibly unacceptable.  I don't know what was going on but it didn't seem busy enough for the kind of service we received.

I can't believe how bad my experience here was.  We came in at 9 on a Saturday with a party of 13.  Big party no reservation, but slightly off hours.  The had a table but needed us to wait for some reason.  We could see the table and it was cleaned off.  After being told it would be 30 minutes we waited OVER and hour before telling hem were going to leave and then immediately sat at the table that had been sitting there unused for an hour.   We ordered our food, and service was slow.  The milk shakes tasted as if they used powder (maybe the ice cream had sat too long)? Would not repeat.  Worst RR experience I've had not that most were much to write home about.

Been here a few times now.. and while service can be hit or miss.. I still can't get myself to really like this chain either. I'm never impressed with their burgers. I think it's their buns that I'm not a fan of; which in turn for me.. makes me not like the burger itself. Their buns feel like they are flaky and end up falling apart, so ya.. total turn off. If I have a burger; especially while dining at a sit down restaurant, I want my burger bun to be substantial and to be able to hold up and not fall apart like their buns do here. Came here recently and while the other people I dined with got burgers.. I got a cup of French Onion soup. Their French onion soup was decent and it had gooey, melted provolone on top! It had plenty of onions inside and a nice beefy, oniony broth.  As for service, we were greeted and seated right away, but I think the hostess was a bit clueless when it comes to the fine art of sitting diners. She basically ended up slamming our server with too many tables thus she was running around like a chicken with her head cut off. Our server did her best to handle the situation and given that she probably had one or two too many tables given to her, she stepped up to the plate. After we gave our orders I knew right away our server was slammed.. and we even overheard the manager telling the young hostess that she had given our server too many tables. I don't come here too often and when I do.. it's usually by someone else's suggestion. If you don't mind somewhat over-priced burgers and flaky, fall apart buns, you'll be fine. The plus side.. they do have bottomless steak fries, broccoli, and sweet potato fries with your burger.

We had a party of 8 and arrived around 9 P.M. We were seated promptly because of the late hour. I always try to order something different than my signature burger but the Royal Red Robin burger is just too good to pass up. A burger patty, bacon, and an egg it doesn't get much better or fatter than that! My burger came out perfect but the fries were unfortunately cold. I immediately asked for a basket of fries to make up for the crummy fries I received. Our waiter was sadly very slow and hardly came around. Our table needed napkins and refills but he was no where to be found. By the time our fries came out we had nearly finished our burgers. The poor service deserves a 2 but the Royal Red Robin burger cooked perfectly medium deserves a 4. I will come back but probably not for some time.

I do enjoy good food and Red Robin can serve it up. Of course it's not the healthiest of places to eat but they offer some good health conscious options. Unfortunately I don't go their for those, I go there for the fries and tasty burgers. I can appreciate the upgrade in presentation and burger choices, they have some great new flavors, including the new sauces available. While the new sauces are good, they are not worth paying the extra for them. This place works for us, especially when we can get a table in the bar. The service is efficient and fries never run out!

Our food was kinda slow and my burger was cold. The service was ok. The other more negative part of our experience was when two men sat next to our table and smoked thier very smelly e cigarettes.  I have asthma and just dont like to smell that while im trying to eat. The men were also being loud and rude to the staff. A bartender decided being rude and mocking the men back was the best idea. The bartender and men continued throwing verbal taunts and swearing towards each other. So everyone forced to watch this big show. The men never were made to leave and they remaind loud till we left. I will not be coming back to this location. The employees did not handle or de-escalate the situation.
they have a pretty good menu, burgers are good. service is sually ok

Usually Red Robins are pretty predictable, not today.  We waited about 10 minutes to be seated, requested a booth for our 2 little kids, they attempted to seat us at a square table, a nice couple volunteered their table for us, it was nice if them.  We ordered and requested some fries while we waited and waited, kids milk came,fries came.  Still no drinks,finally got the drinks,  drained the coke waited for our food,  no refill, still eating. Started eating the whiskey river BBQ wrap.  Tortilla was like eating rubber, kept waiting for someone to come check on us, nothing for 10 min-  we saw the couple that moved for us with a partially eaten wrap too-same issue-rubbery. Finally asked some one to contact our server, asked about the food-he runs off to the kitchen before I could finish-the kitchen said it was fine.  No response to my feedback or the neighbors food issue.  and I still have an empty coke.  I don't fault these guys but the should acknowledge my concerns. I left the plate in finished, never did get the coke refill and extra fries I requested for a refill.  We will not be coming back here.  Given it was a Sunday and they were reasonably busy.  My wife's food on the other hand was good.

Just want to rave about our server, Bethany. Best service I have EVER received at a Red Robin anywhere. I have been a long time customer and in the recent years have gone very infrequently due to poor service and mediocre food. Bethany has restored my faith in Red Robin. I may only eat at the Federal Way location (and only after verifying that she is there) but I will still be a customer!! The food overall was back to the high standards that Red Robin used to be known for. Again - not sure if it was the location or the planets were all in alignment!! Thank you taking care of the hungry softball players and fans Bethany - you Rock!!

I remember when Red Robin had great burgers, salads, and fries. Now, you are lucky if you get a good meal. Even their fat fries are typically a disappointment. I don't know why I ever eat here, I am constantly disappointed.  Cobb salad is horrible. You can get a better burger at any of the burger joints in FW. Their chicken strips are horrible. I can get better at Burger Express or The Ram.  Their fries have gone downhill. I can usually get a few good ones in the bunch, but the majority are the reject fries that should be tossed and not served to customers.
I been to other red robin a lot but this federal way location was my second favorite over all food was amazing and server was good everything was really good!!!!

We used to go here every week for happy hour.  They decided to quit offering happy hour and we decided to go elsewhere.  Try Azteca right next door,  Buffalo wild wings,  etc. Lots of better choices nearby.

Always, always, ALWAYS busy.  Whenever I come here there is always a wait.  I must be cursed or something...  but at least the staff is always friendly, appear to be cleaned, smile a lot and are willing to have small chatty conversations with you, if you want.  The food is pretty typical for a Red Robin but even though it's not their fault... the whole Franchise needs to stop with the dumb silver cylinder for the fries... it's just a pain to have to pull it off and then set aside.  Just dump my fries on the plate and bring it to me.  That means less hands are touching my food to have to shove them in the dumb thing.  If you like your booze... skip this place.  The drinks are SUPER OVER PRICED and super tiny!!!  You're better of hitting up a real bar than trying to get your drink on here... I did like they automatically brought my party two extra plates of fries this time!  That was great!  I didn't have to wait an eternity for that to happen this time.  So if you want Red Robin, come to this one and not the one in Auburn!

This place is really bad.  Smoke/Pepper burger was nearly $15 and not worth that at all. This company has changed a lot of things and NOT for the better. People were nice but overall it was not worth it, you should go somewhere else entirely. This particular location is run down and not well run. Red Robin used to fun to go to, but not any more. Too bad

Bad service . Our waitress didn't even ask for our drinks first . Her name was janette . Was rude and unprofessional . Two thumbs down. I'd fire her lol long story short - two big thumbs down. Don't wanna come there anymore.

Red Robin is a known quantity and this place is like any other one EXCEPT- whatever they use to clean the place is the same stuff they use to clean bathrooms.  You walk in and it smells like, well a restaurant bathroom. Kind of a nasty mood-kill..

Great service & good food today!  My hubby loves the Banzie Burger & always orders it!  I like their newish smaller Tavern Double Burger. My son had a BBQ wrap. All were tasty & served with a smile!  That plus the rewards program make it worthwhile to come back again soon!

Had dinner with my daughter. We were seated right way. That part was fine. I ordered a Teriakki Burger and was served a Teriakki chicken sandwich. I had a hard time flagging down our waitress once I realized. By the time my new burger came my daughter was completely finished with her dinner. They were slow. I tried to keep it a fun night so ordered some dessert for my daughter to have while I ate my dinner. It was only some cake, nothing they had to cook but they took so long bringing it I wS do e eating my new burger when it came. Very disappointed and will not be back.

I came when they were very busy and in the chaos the staff seemed to be lost. Not seating people in order fries were cold or tasted microwaved. Waitress was great and tried to accommodate us with new fries but the food was still just 2 stars at best. I love red Robin just not this location

This location is great!! My grandma had a very restrictive diet. The waitress was so sweet. She had the kitchen make something special just for grandma. She talked to her and checked if she needed more. We all got to have a nice meal because of the servers here. I'll come back any day.

My boss and I frequent this location often. The food is good, and the service is great. RR is always our first choice, because it's always fun to arrive and the bartender knows what we want. Thanks and keep it up guys!

We were at this location on Saturday at around 5:00 p.m. for a late lunch/early dinner. While the manager and our waiter were very nice and helpful, this location felt sort of old, dated and kinda greasy. That said, I really liked the allergy-specific ordering program they have. (They bring you a tablet and you can see all the food available to you within your specific allergy. Its great!) I ordered a cheeseburger on a gluten-free bun, french fries and had to also oder soda as their water was really, really gross. My burger would have been really yummy had it not arrived burnt. But I was hungry and it wasn't horrible, so I just kept eating.  It IS an older location, but you can tell they haven't changed/upgraded with the times decor/furnature-wise. I'll go back to Red Robin, just not this particular location.  [Thank you to the manager for being so nice and helpful with the ordering.]

This is probably the worse of all the Red Robbins in the area - at least half the time we have issues.  Today - lets see where to begin.   First they had one gentlemen handling at least 5 tables that just sat down - we had 6 people at ours - too many tables for him - they need to get someone at the front who knows how to space customers out. We got our orders and asked for our soup to come first.     Finally I asked where our food is and he went and checked.   -  Everything came at once - the cold soup - the cold burgers - the cold mac and cheese, etc.    I am guessing he was not doing his job and checking and the soup had been sitting up there for some time - followed by the food. I had him replace the soups - but we were now getting concerned about the time - took too long - so ate the cold food.     Kids asked for refills on the Mac and Cheese and again waited and waited.   I finally went up to the counter and asked the first server I saw - should I get our food that is sitting there or can you bring it.   (Obviously she glared but brought it).    Our table had no attention paid to it - how is the food, etc.  No refills of drinks - anything we needed I had to flag down someone.  At the end I talked to the manager and he took care of the bill - letting us know his store is #1 in the area - really - hard to believe. The manager did take care of the whole meal and - while we appreciated the free meal - we did not go our to get cold food for free.   As I said this is not the first time this has happened.   Usually we go to the Red Robbin in Auburn - 100% better managed.

Is there ZERO stars? This location has definitely declined over the past 6-7 years. Sometimes you get that RR craving, but we should know better than to come here. There's an issue 9 times out of 10. Bad service, not enough servers, "bottomless fries" is a term that's subject to interpretation at this location; they really act like it's a problem bringing you more fries. When they "get around to it" 10 minutes later, there's like 8-10 fries in the basket-really? The staff act like it's coming out of their pockets. Weak iced tea, over priced drinks, lame chicken strips; very small for $13.00!! and the place smells like a public bathroom when you walk in. The Auburn and Des Moines locations are slightly better.  I do think their food is overpriced in general.

Red robin is a good place to go and talk to old friends, or be with the family. Their fries are delicious! (Always order some to snack on when they take your drink order) and the burgers are always produced to great standards! I appreciate the atmosphere, and will always recommend going to red robin any day of the week!

I have been here several times and the food is fairly on par with other red robin's however the service can be hit or miss depending on who you get, there is one bar tender in particular that while he is always nice is not very attentive and just to slow to work behind a bar.

So, with this review I will add a photo.  Let me first start it off by saying that good service goes a LONG way. Very, long way.  We ordered an appetizer which was the fried zucchini and mozzarella sticks. They were pretty good. My spouse and son enjoyed their food and loved every bit of it. My son had mac and cheese and my spouse had the reds big tavern. I however was going to have a salad, but was won over when I saw the photo of the DGB burger. It sounded absolutely phenomenal. Fresh Arugula, garlic aioli and a nice angus beef patty. All on a ciabatta bun. Well... It was everything the photo showed besides the fact that it was completely raw in the middle. The outside however was VERY crunchy and burnt. I'm going to safely assume that it was made on a very high flame. Anyways, I tried to eat around the raw burger but couldn't do it. I ended up losing my appetite and hardly had any of my food at all. I ended up waiting for the waiter to come and take it away. I explained to him the situation, now here's where they got four stars. I know mistakes are made but when the manager himself comes by to apologize for the burger and explains how those patties are a lot more thicker than the regular burgers and are a little tricky to make. It was nice that he did that, but then he removed my burger from our bill, offered me something else on the house, which I didn't want because my appetite wasn't there anymore. So he proceeded to then to tell me that he will also take off 50% off the new bill. Which was our appetizer and my sons food and my hubby's food. Our bill was a total of 10$ I was shocked that they went out of their way to make me happy. It was nice that they admitted to their mistakes and did what they could to fix it. Not many places do this instead they just give you a small discount off your bill and send you on your way. And never apologize. I will be returning to this red Robbin, mostly because of the good service I was given. And if my burger was cooked fully I'm sure I would've loved it as much as the rest of my family loved their food.

Went here last night with my buddy and were greeted with a smile and offered the restaurant or bar, we chose the bar. Went up there and were asked to pull out our IDs, but then she walked away and left them on the table for another 5 minutes. Came back and took our order.  I ordered ice water and the California chicken burger extra pickles crispy patty, he got the a1 burger extra mayo with onion straws on the side and a strawberry lemonade.  The cooks took a good half hour to prepare our meal. I was a little pissed. Our fries were slightly cold, the burgers were great aside from the fact that they forgot my pickles, and didn't put mayo or onion straws on his order. The waitress was sweet and apologized and brought us everything we needed.  Overall it wasn't my best red robin experience, but the food did the job. Not sure if she heard me complaining but I was really pleased that the waitress came back and apologized, she sounded really sincere which is why I give them 3 stars.

I always like to try their new burgers, so I had the Holiday Turkey Burger.  It was topped with sweet potato fries, cranberry sauce and bacon.  The burger was juicy and tasty.  We upgraded to garlic herb fries for $0.99 but there wasn't much garlic, herbs or cheese on it :(. They were really busy so the service was a little slow.

First of all, you have to get in the building.   If you have a wheelchair the only way you can see is to use the restaurant next door's curb cut.  Then you get to the front steps.  There appears to not be any ramp.  You get some help and lift the chair up the steps.  Then you go in.  (Lots of nice customers help).  You are inside!!  A hostess asks how many?  Two.  But wait, there is steps to about 3/4th of the tables.  Can we sit in the bar?   The hostess explains that there is a ramp (dark and to the left side as you look from the parking lot).  If you want into the bar or another lowered area, they will help you go back outside and through the exit doors to the area.  Wow!!  We get a seat in the main accessible area.  It is such that the wheelchair sticks out and is about 24 inches from another customer's chair.  Everyone has to go sideways by you.   Luckily it is back close to the kitchen so not too many people are discouraged by the blockage.   Good service, Excellent blue cheese burger (I can't remember the exact name), but it was hot, quick, good taste, and with the normal Red Robin quality fries.  My wife had the Tavern Burger on a wheat bun with a salad, all of very good quality.   Actually the buns were a little oily (slippery to the touch).   The stars are for the food, If I would just rate the food and table service I would probably rate it a 5.   Accessibilty and knowledge about accessing the restaurant is a zero.  I hope the designer of the building is unemployed and I would like to see management spend some time in a wheelchair, and then train the staff.    I have been to a lot of Red Robins but this layout is horrible.  (I am from Oregon, and they have a wonderful location and layout at the Red Robin in Bend)

Went here the other night, our waiter was amazing he was nice, funny, bubbly and efficient. Everything we asked for he got correct we didn't wait for our drinks or refills we got our food quickly nice and piping hot food was good service was amazing. Great experience, we come here a lot and the experience is always good but this particular night was great and it was our wait staff that really pushed it to the top :-)

Medioker service, half our food was good, and the other half kinda sucked. Their cook needs to learn how to cook a steak prooerly. Was over cooked. And then they froze us out with air conditiining at the end of our meal. Then took 40 min to get our desert after the order was placed.

This place is my go-to restaurant when I'm craving a burger and fries. The food is good but the customer service can do some improving. Every time I eat here with my girlfriend, the waitress will serve us our food and about five minutes later when me and my girlfriend are about to take our first bite, the waitress stops by to ask how the food is and never comes back until she hands us our check. This has happened almost every time I've visited. And I visit about a couple times a month. Considering I used to be a food server, here's a tip for red robin's waiters/waitresses: ask your customers how the food is AFTER they've taken a bite of their food. And check up on your customers when they're about half way finished!  Also, I've noticed recently that if you have bottomless fries, they literally serve you about 5 fries each time.  I'm still going to give it 3 stars because the burgers and fries are making me coming back!

Our family has been going to this location for years regularly and everything has been great until last Sunday. After having dinner there, me and my son got really bad food poisoning ( we both had the BLTA sandwich). I called the restaurant and asked to speak to the GM and when he got on the phone, he never introduced himself. I told him about the food poisoning and all he said was "Oh really?!? Well I guess I will take your name and number for insurance purposes." He just blew me off, no apology or assuring me that he will talk to kitchen staff about food safety..... NOTHING. After such poor customer service, they lost some very regular customers. So disappointed!

I went in after shopping last night. I have been seeing advertisements for the Crab Cake Burger and knew it was only available for a limited time, so I chose Red robin. I have always had good experiences with this chain. I even had a good experience a few years back at the same location.  Anyways... Right away I noticed that sticky film that is present at "Dirty" restaurants. On the table, the salt shaker and the menu's. YUCK Second, I noticed all prices had gone up, no big deal if the quality of the food was worthy. My $14.95 Crab Cake Burger was mediocre, at best. I was so disappointed. I dipped what I did eat in the Spicy Thai (extra charge) dipping sauce to render it edible as I was starving.  Our Freckled Lemonades were served in regular glassware instead of the cute glassware I've come accustomed to. Again, no big deal, but even they were watered down tasting. Dang. Our server was fabulous, she definitely tried. We did not complain. But I will not return. Ever. P.S. The bathroom door was sticky feeling as well, gross
It's what you expected. Lots of people a decent Burger and a good mixed drink.However the fries are boring.

Red Robin is always a favorite. The Federal Way location is always busy, no matter what time or day. They are prepared for that and get you in and out. Food is always good and you can always know what you're getting. We always go back.

Not bad.  I haven't been to this location as much as the one in Bellevue, but it's about the same.  I still enjoy their bottomless sweet potato fries, just didn't like how the first batch we got with our burgers here was cold, and I didn't get the onions I asked for on my burger, which would have made my burger just a little bit better.  But the waiter we had was very friendly.
FREEZING. Could not enjoy lunch because it was so cold. They didn't cut the air conditioning even when nicely asked. Three of our tables were so cold. Even moved but it didn't help.

I have loved Red Robin since I was a kid. Their steak fries and Bonzai burgers are a constant craving of mine. My husband and I love their food and it's one of our first choices for dining out. However, this has to be my least favorite location. It's regularly crowded and sitting in the bar dining area has proven to receive slow service for the most part. The last time we came in I ordered a salad and half of the ingredients were missing. It's a salad I order regularly so I certainly noticed, but the server/manager actually argued with me on what comes on the salad (read your menu, dummy). Also the service has been really bad in the dining area lately too. The stars of this restaurant are Marsha (I think that's her name. Asian lady who has worked there a long time and very sweet) and the hostess Rae, she makes me smile the instant I walk in and talks to me like we are best friends. Love her.  Now that my husband and I realized we can buy frozen Red a Robin brand steak fries to make at home we have been coming less often, but I will always return for my beloved Bonzai Burger.

Let's start with the host. He was too busy talking to the other hostess and took over five minutes to say anything . But when an American family walks in he greats them and ask how many and so on . Then he's like how can I help you . No shit I need to get seated . Some people are so idk . I left . They are a chain and won't be losing any money from me .

I went to Red Robin for the first time in a few years on the 9th of May 2015. I received my birthday burger and placed an order for a medium size strawberry shake that was terrible. The milkshake wasn't completely blended. There were big chunks of strawberry while the rest of the shake was watery  with chunks of ice cream. I've always enjoyed shakes at Red Robin but this wasn't smooth at all. There was no effort put into making this shake properly.

Just like any other Red Robin, but the people at each location really make the place. Our server Denise was amazing! Not only did she tend to us like we were the only ones there, but she had also other tables to tend to in her section and it was a very busy night! I came in to redeem my birthday burger and she was very helpful in explaining what I can and cannot order. Which is helpful because I hate getting my hopes up and have my eye on something super tasty (I mean everything at Red Robin is deliciously consistent) then having to change because it's not part of the "deal". I order the Prime Chophouse burger and a raspberry limeade which was amazing! My Boyfriend orders the Whisky River BBQ chicken wrap and it looked good and my boyfriend enjoyed it as well!  Anyway, back to Denise, at the end of our meal when she brings us the check, she asks if I would like a birthday sundae, singing optional. I opted for the sundae sans the singing. I'm 31 now and I don't want to make a huge spectacle of myself at a Red Robin. Denise, I want you to be my server again when I come back to your Red Robin! I have never, in my 31 years of eating at restaurants, ever been treated amazingly by any server! If I had more money to tip I would have. Thanks for making my birthday dinner very special! I'd totally come back and sit in her section when I'm in the area!

Ok so I decided to try out Red Robin again...we went to the Commons Mall Red Robin and this was a totally different experience! The waitress was amazing and the food was cooked perfectly. The whole ambiance was so different from the Des Moines one...which I now believe is where I had the bad service..I didn't know there was two of them so close to us(I am a bit new to this town) and apologize for that HUGE mistake, I will certainly double check my addresses next time. I highly recommend this Red Robin...all the people were happy there..the servers were chatty and highly efficient and made sure our eating experience was a good one!

I'm so sad. We seated our self in the bar as the young male who greeted everyone ignored us, while chit chatting with two other female coworkers. So, without waiting I walked to the bar. Thank goodness for being old. Once there, no one greeted us or gave us menus, however, there was the bartender, two bussers, and two servers. I got up, walked to the host and asked for 2 menus. He asked why no one brought them to us. I bluntly stated "You ignored us while readily talking and we have no idea who's covering our section". We waited five minutes and still nothing. Then a gal came up and took our appetizer order and drinks and before I could finish ordering she ran off for another 5 minutes. Um... OK! I was so hungry and it was my birthday meal. I wasn't thrilled as this seems to be a continuous theme. I almost called over the manager. She mozied (spelling?) on back and asked if we were going to order anything else. I said I tried but she walked away. She said she was sorry busy running around. If you can't handle six tables, perhaps this isn't a good fit for a Friday evening in the bar as a server. Eh?  The great thing, which I will give her credit for and giving her a tip when she was losing points at the beginning. She did refill my husbands drink, which made me happy and brought him fries just in case. That gave her brownie points and made up for the long wait and walking away while I was in mid order.  I miss the top notch service. This location isn't as great as it used to be. :( However, it's far better than the those in Puyallup.  I may have to find a new family restaurant. :(
I had the black and blue burger on an onion bun during a business meeting..food was good and service was quick. My drink was the raspberry limeade, which I wouldn't order again-it was too tart.

We always try to sit in the bar as the service seems to be a bit more attentive especially when it comes to keeping the drinks fillled. It's first come first served so sometimes if there is a line for the dining area you can walk right through and find a seat wihout the wait. As to the food... they don't seem to mind special orders and carry gluten free buns which are few and far between for most other burger joints. If you are a frequent diner here it's worth it to sign up for their royalty club where you get a free meal on your birthday, $20.00 on your 6th visit and every 10th burger is free! The only issue I have is that they recently changed their salt and pepper shakers to those little grinding mills which can be a bit of a challenge for some of the older folks and/or those with arthritis. I'm not quite there yet myself but I've seen a few struggle with them. Updating my past review as we just came in and our waitress just warned us that it was going to take a really long time to get served as she was all alone with 6 tables ahead of us. This typically comes down to poor management.

The waitress Denise is a dream! We love her and always ask to sit in her area! Why God, why did RR change the salads? They are so gross. I miss the old perfectly delicious salads. If it's not broke, don't fix it! Wahhhh (that's be being a baby about the gross salads)  Cheese sticks yummy. Burgers good. Campfire sauce is amazing.

So my boyfriend and I usually really enjoy the other red robins that we have been too but this one just sucks. We've tried them a few times and there is always something wrong from bad service to issues with our meals. But the most recent experience we we're using there to go since we were given a gift card and wanted to get rid of it, we ordered fine and thought we ordered just two burgers and some mozzarella sticks but when I went to pick it up it turns out that the waitress that took our order added extra burgers to our meal so we had four burgers. Making my expected 25$ meal into a 45$ meal. On top of that they messed up the burgers that we really wanted and there was hair on the fries.

Not the best service. The food is great I will give them that. Have had a few too many wrong orders delivered to our table. Timing on getting things out can be better. I enjoy that atmosphere and it's family oriented. Keeps me returning for that reason.
Tavern burger is a great deal, very tasty and only $6.95, one turnoff, we sat in the bar and the table was sticky!  Yuk..
Not sure if I got a dirty glass, or if the receipt fell in the ice bin? Regardless it put a damper on the meal itself. The manager did come over to apologize.

Worst service for Togo. They hang up on you while they placed you on hold, I finally gotten my order taken after 3 tries calling back and now waited for over 25 minutes, and my food is still yet to be brought out. I only ordered a burger and fries, waitress said she will be right back with my check and I'm still waiting to pay. She never gave me a wait time on how long or if she checked on my food. 7:20 pm, so that the GM or whoever is reading this needs to train there waitresses better.

Worst red robin experience ever. Ive frequented red robin from so cal to seattle. The team is usually happy, engaging, friendly and appeasing to the customer. Not this location. The hospo seems to be suffering from permanent resting bitch face and the manager never came by to see how our experience was. Im. Going to give the server the benifit of the doubt and say she could not here us order she kept saying "what" like it was in style even though it wasn't busy. Usually i could make substitutions and alterations to the menubn not here. Worst experience ever

We walked in and was instantly overwhelmed by a smell that I can only describe as dirty diapers. No one was at the hostess station so we waited patiently until we were seated by a lady who gave us the impression that she hated her job. The booth seat was torn and everything looked worn and dirty. I knew we wouldn't enjoy any food with the stench in the air so we left before ordering. I won't be back.
To many things to list off that were not professional. Id rather go spend 40$ at any fast food place and come out happier.

Beware!!  They are no longer honoring the free tavern double burger when the Seahawks score in the red zone.  They now require you to buy an appetizer in addition to another burger to get the free one.  The ad that I got in my email did not say anything about that new requirement so I called the Mat the manager and he said the old email ad was sent by mistake but he would send me a credit to me.  I have yet to get it so I Guess he was just putting me off.  I think I am more bothered by Mat lying to me more than the policy change.  We won't be comming back for a while.

You would expect the hostess station to be facing the door so they can greet the customers when they come in the door.  But no.  Today about 4:20 we went, and there were people in front of us waiting to be seated and another group behind us waiting to be seated.  There were two servers ( it looked like a server and a trainee who was following her around) at the hostess station looking at the computer screen for about five minutes with their backs to us.  When they were done looking at the screen they walked away. They didn't even look our way.  A couple of minutes later a guy came and asked if we had been helped.  He seated us.  Then we waited 10 minutes for a server to come take our order.  We got our burger and sandwich in about 12 minutes.  We had to wait another 8 minutes for the appetizer to come out.  We then waited about 10 minutes for our bill,  I finally got up and told the manager we were leaving.  He showed me how to work the little bill payer machine on the table.  As we were leaving, we were panhandled on the way out the door by a guy in a wheelchair sitting between the two entry doors.  I recognized him as the same guy that was escorted out of the Rite Aid store I was at a couple of weeks ago because he was caught twice shoplifting there.  The employee there was telling him he better not come back.  Perhaps if the hostess station was facing the door the hostess would see what was going on.

Stinky, sticky, gross. This place is not going to last much longer if they don't take care of the place. It's falling apart. The staff should have time to clean, now that I can check myself out with their handy dandy ziosk. Not going back. Too bad, I used to like it. Feels like Denny's now.

I've been to this Red Robin about a dozen times in the last 5 years, but evidently, haven't written a review.  Sad that my last visit was bad and that is what is going to be posted.  I came in on 12/16 for dinner with three others.  It took too long for the waitress to take our orders but I didn't think anything of it at the time.  However, when she didn't bring or offer more fries, never refilled my soda, didn't bring napkins, and didn't clear plates the benefit of the doubt went out the window.  She gave us a sob story out of the blue when she came by to   cash us out.  We were in the middle of talking and then she came up to the table and started talking.  We stopped our conversation.  She was telling us how she was ok, things would work out, even though her life was hard.  What?  She then told us that she was trying to cope by being at work.  One of my friends, trying to show sympathy, said that sometimes work helps one deal with stress.  The waitress agreed.  There was this weird, awkward pause.  Then the waitress said she would cash us out.  Oh I get it!  She wanted a big tip for her bad service.   Red Robin has mini kiosks on the tables now that you have to use to pay.  The waitress showed my friend that graciously offered to pay the tab.  She hovered over her while she tipped her.  Not cool. My burger was fine.  Someone ordered a cup of soup - come on girl, don't pretend you don't eat.  My other friend got fish and chips and the other person ordered a burger.  No one complained but no one said it was good either.  Half of my fries were hard as a rock.  It would have been nice to get more fries.   When the server brought the food, she set all of the sauces on the edge of the table, away from where we were all sitting instead of taking two seconds to ask what sauce went to what person.  Don't be lazy, do your job.  It's not hard. The acoustics in this RR is bad.  We couldn't hear each other without speaking loudly due to the noise and large open space.  I've been here on a night when you can hear each other.  And no, none of us are losing our hearing. Saw a lot of people waiting for a table when there were booths and tables empty next to us.  Not a fan of that situation. Parking close to this RR is crammed.  You're better off parking in the back end of Target and walking over. Food: 3 Service: 0 Ambiance: 2 Parking: 3

There's no Red Robin (RR) from where I live but for some reason, they always show their commercials and I'm always catching myself singing the "yummm" part at the end lol. Talk about a big tease :( lol. On our trip to WA, my boyfriend mentioned there was a RR near where his parents lived. Knowing this information, I was determined to make at least one stop there. I've only been to RR once, but that was a long time ago when I was a little girl. So I don't have any comparisons to other locations to include in my review but I can say it's better than Ruby Tuesday lol. We came to this location on a Saturday afternoon. We found parking easily and we got sat right away. Sweet. Since I couldn't remember my last experience at a RR, looking over their massive menu was a bit overwhelming! Luckily I was there with my boyfriend and his sister who knew the menu a lot better than me. They pointed out a couple of their favorite burgers and mentioned that RR was also known for their unlimited bottomless fries that came with unlimited dipping sauces (only the Classic dipping sauces were free). Um say whaaaaaat?  Our waitress was nice, but service was a bit slow on her end. When we were ready to order, she was nowhere to be found. After we got our food and she placed all our dipping sauces in the middle, she didn't bother to explain which was which. And when we wanted to order more bottomless fries and more dipping sauces, we had to flag her down to get her attention. But regardless of the service, we still enjoyed our food. We all ordered their gourmet burgers and even though the presentation of the burger looked nothing like their picture in the menu, the taste was still there. I ordered the Whiskey River BBQ, and pretty much cleaned my plate. The bottomless fries were just alright. It wasn't as crispy as I usually like it, but the dipping sauce was what really made it delicious. The Campfire sauce was our favorite! Overall, my cravings were satisfied and I left happy :)

I love mushrooms!!! The sautéed shroom is the burger that pretty much changed my perspective on mushrooms and the service was pretty good and fast. Server consistently gave us refills on our lemonades

We were at the Federal Way Red Robin last night for my son's 5th birthday. As I child we loved coming here for birthdays, awesome food, the birthday song with the balloons and HUGE Sunday (always with whip cream and sprinkles and a cherry on top) I also remember standing on the chair and wearing a mask or something of the sort. Last night was probably one of the worst experiences at Red Robin I have ever had. We had a large party and John, our server seemed pretty new. First off the location was out of three different beers, Stella, Sierra Nevada and one other. This took us about 20 minutes to find out as we ordered one, then the other then the final. Which we were aware wasn't the fault of our server but when  the first beer of choice was gone he probably should have found out which beers were available on tap, not make the person ordering find out in the period of 20 minutes. Another person finally after 15 minutes went to the bar to pick up her drink she had ordered. Everything took a really long time. We finally ordered around 7, 30 minutes after arrival. Food arrived around 8, there were 10 meals ordered, 3 of which were for children. Multiple items were wrong, I received the completely wrong burger and my sister in-laws was supposed to be a turkey burger. She sent hers back and I just ate what was given to me. Hers came back about 15 minutes later (which we were surprised it was so quick). Fries were cold, my burger was lukewarm and one of our milkshakes ordered was the consistency of heavy cream. We were there for a little over two hours. We received our check then I asked our waiter if they would please sing to my son. A Sunday came about 10 minutes later that looked like it may have been prepared at 6:30 when we arrived, it was less thick than a milk shake. There was no candle, no whip cream or sprinkles. It was a very sad evening and I am extremely disappointed in our choice to have our son's birthday her. Red robin, I would now say, is consistently less than mediocre across the board.

They have a new system to call the waiter to your table and I hit the call button and the waiter never came at all. I was very disappointed. The waitress was also very rude to me and my company with me. I also was screwed up on my appetizer order.
My husband and I like to sit in the bar area usually better service. We come here frequently, we like the gluten-free buns and endless fries. Food is consistently good and nice watching sports.

I came in for lunch recently and was very disappointed with my experience. I have a service dog who was laying by my side and the waiter stepped on him and proceeded to make a huge scene about how bad the dog scared him. I was absolutely mortified. The staff needs to be educated on correct behavior around service animals. And the kitchen got my order wrong.

All the hostesses have serious resting bitch face. They're sour to you as soon as you walk in the door, if you're lucky enough to for them to even acknowledge you. Really ruins the vibe of the place. There's nothing like going somewhere where you anticipate a good time and know that you'll be spending money, only to feel extremely unwelcome as soon as you walk in.

Late night dinner and from the start the hostess was on it friendly and curteous. Then the wonderful service continued with our server who was fast and friendly never letting our drinks go below half full. The resteraunt was very clean including the facilities.   Now for the best part, the mushroom burger was cooked correct and the flavor was very good and with the sautéed garlic mushrooms it just made your mouth water until the next bite. The salad was a very large portion and with fresh vegetables it had the right garden flavor and the chicken was grilled perfectly.

Wow, this restaurant has gone way downhill since I was a kid. Service is poor- mediocre at best. I got a to go order and asked for sauces to go with my chicken strips. I received none in the box. My fries were cold and were not seasoned. I normally wouldn't complain but this was third time in a row where I've had an issue with this restaurant and location in particular. I thought I'd be correct and call to let the manager know. I wasn't looking to receive or ask for anything- I just felt the manager needed to know service was not up to par. The manager apologized, told me it wasn't the first time he's received a complaint and that there were issues with this restaurant. He then said he would send me a gift card to refund me for my purchases. Funny thing is, I never received anything in the mail. I feel like he just BS'd me. I won't be going back to this location... Possibly this establishment.

This was it, what is wrong with this establishment? The quality is down to the toilet.  Extremely slow service and had to flag down the waiter for everything.  It took us 1 hour to get the food and I had to flag down the waiter to see why it was taking forever to get the food.  When he brought the food it was almost cold.  I noticed that RR cut their portions down as well.  We used to go to RR at least once a month but now in the last 2 years we've cut way down - in the last year we've only been there once. Lots of empty tables but they still make people wait.  After spending 1 1/2 hours today to wait for a table and then for the food, I think I'm going to avoid RR permanently.

The service here is slow,  the fries were cold had to keep asking for fresh or hot fries. Food is ok, but each time we come here its a different experience. Took 10 minutes for someone to actually see us come through the door to be seated. Our server never asked us if our food was good or could he get us anything else. They always forget to ask us for our Red Robin card so we miss out on our free burgers and discounts.

The service here is notoriously inconsistent. On our most recent visit, we found multiple hairs in our burgers. Absolutely disgusting. Had we not cut the burger in half with a knife prior to taking a bite, we would have had a mouthful of gross hairs. The manager told us he would comp the burger with the hair, but we would have to pay for its replacement. Yes- you read that correcty. What passive aggressive BS is that? Why not just tell me you're not going to do anything about it instead?

Been craving a good burger for a few days now so decided to visit the Federal Way location since it is the closest to our house. Walked in around 545ish to find the lobby a zoo :( luckily scored a booth in the bar which gf doesn't like but we didn't want to wait for half an hour.  Bill was our server and made this a 5 star experience, WAY to GO Bill! By far the best service I think we have had at a red robin even. From our initial greetings to our last farewell Bill was helpful, attentive, fast and pleasant. Ordered a sampler which we were informed a few minutes later that one of the items we requested wasn't available so we just more of Fried Zucchini . After demolishing out Mozzarella Sticks and Zucchini within minutes, Bill brought out the extra Zucchini that apparently we didn't get originally for our 3rd side. Recognizing that we wouldn't be able to eat our meals he offered to remove the 3rd side since it came out so late. Awesome! Of course, we stated that we would still pay for them if needed and he didn't want to have any part of that since we didn't eat them. A few minutes later, our meals arrived which were delicious. I had the same meal that I have had at a Red Robin for the last 10 years at least; Bacon Cheddar Burger - Well Done, Cut in half PLZ! Gf tried a new chicken burger which she liked.  Couldn't be happier with the the dinner choice tonight. Will definitely be back to this location!

What a awful experience! Took our son here for his birthday, where I told the host, server and manager it was his birthday. He got a burnt burger and not one happy birthday no cake ice cream nothing! Our server did not check on us once after dropping off food water glasses empty since our other son just got done with baseball and was extra thirsty! So thanks red Robin for making this my sons worse birthday ever! He also lost his phone there but since I left a 10% not the normal 20% I leave no one found his phone

We love this location!, The food is always fresh and we love the healthy selections on the menu.  We were here last Saturday evening. I'm always so impressed by the two gentlemen managers running food cleaning tables and making sure each table is perfect.  Our server was Denise.  She is absolutely the very best server I have had any where and we will now call ahead to make sure we have a table in her section.  For the very best service and have all the hard work done for you. Request Denise!!!;

Lester is the worst server! I am no longer going to be eating at red robin, strictly to avoid this turd! His actions are decided based on whether or not he thinks he will get in trouble rather than helping the customer. He spent 20 minutes trying to fix the stupid machine to pay for our meal as opposed to giving us a paper check, all because he claimed he would get in trouble! Than he gets to our table smelling like he just ate a pack of cigarettes!! I wish I could say this was our only interaction with this unwilling and uncaring human, but unfortunately we have had many experiences with Lester and every time has been an extreme let down. A shame cuz the food is good! We just ate at the ram across the street and received excellent service, guess they will continue to receive our business.

Food was really good, came out pretty fast. I got a Baileys Milk shake it too was really good. Service was okay, I felt rushed though like the server didn't want us there. Also the "unlimited" fries apparently have a limit...me and my boyfriend were cut off after our 3rd basket. After the 2nd one she came and asked if we needed anything else I asked for another basket. She then said something like okay Ill go get your last basket. Wouldn't give us any more sauce either. Then brought the check and said have a nice day.... I wasnt done though!!!! Kind of frustrating especially given how much the check was. Kind of wish I would have went to a different location maybe where I would have been more welcome.

This location is a black eye for Red Robin. I am a frequent Red Robin customer and I have tried this location three times because it is the closest to my house and all three times I have been extremely disappointed. I will not be back. The restaurant is dark, out dated and dirty. The floor has food all over it like it is halfway vacuumed maybe once a week. The food has literally come to our table with a hair in it. This last experience we walked out before even ordering due to the cleanliness of the restaurant. The table we we sat at was wet on one half from the dirty rag wipe down and food left on the other half from not being cleaned. My wife had to bounce back up after sitting down from sitting in water and I had to get napkins to wipe the salt and chunks of food from the seat on my side. Trying to push past all this at the beginning I then had to separate the sticky pages of the menu..... Ok, had enough of the review yet? Right? That's about the point I just decided to say, no thanks, we are leaving. I like Red Robin. Most establishments are pretty typical, this location clearly lacks the strong management that is needed to keep a restaurant clean and respectful. This place is surviving on the mall and freeway location. Sad. Updated this review (all written above) from a two star to a one star. Against my better judgment on my previous visit, my son wanted Red Robin and since it had been over a year since my last review I thought I might be able to play it safe and get out unscathed... WRONG. it was an utter failure that ended up not paying for one of the burgers and the app that was just deplorable. I'm done. Not headed back unless I have been told management has been changed and the restaurant is attempting to head in a new direction, until then I will visit the other Red Robin locations if I feel the need for Red Robin.
Usually love going to red robin but this time was not so fun. This place is disgusting and the service was very slow. There are dirty dishes near the bar and the floors were very dirty

The food was not even average and the cleanliness is lacking.  Should have known before we walked in; homeless girl sitting next to the entry. It's Saturday at 3PM and my wife and I bellied up to the bar, after we found two seats together with an almost clean area, bar top not wiped down. The bathrooms have trash all over the place with papers everywhere.  Obvious it has not been serviced in hours, not sure if there's a manager on duty checking on this. 26 minutes to receive our boneless chicken wings and 1/2 order of rings. Over cooked and not even warm. Generally we liked RR (not yum) from other locations but this one was the worst. Won't go back. Oh we'll, there are four or five other restaurants nearby

Came in at 5:20, seated at 6 after 2 complaints of many many people who came in after us being seated.  We did not get our food until 730.  We have 4 kids, one who is diabetic.  We were seated right next to the kitchen and watched table after table , even ones with large groups (who were seated after us) get their food, eat AND leave.  We HATE complaining, but told the manager that if it took any longer we would leave.  Miraculously our food appeared.  Fries were cold, burger inconsistent, Luke warm or cold.  All drink orders had to be reordered because they kept getting forgotten.  Rediculous.  Will not come back.  Manager is incredibly rude.
The wait is ridiculous. I got there at 6:30, didn't get seated until 7:00, and now it's 735 and no food in sight. Don't go here unless you want to wait 2 hours for food.

This Red Robin location has the worst service, EVER. On several occasions I have been there ( I only go because it is closest to my home ), the service is terrible! Recently, on Cinco de Mayo, they weren't very busy. My friends & I walked in asked to be seated, the server told us to go sit in the  bar we would get faster service, we didn't see any available tables so the waitress seated us at one. So we sat the table, for a waiter to come out telling us a man was sitting there that had just gotten up.. Umm okay so is he coming back? Did he leave? What? We told him waitress sat us at this specific table instead of the dining area. He was like well IDK what he is doing, we were so frustrated just ended up leaving. I won't go here anymore, always a horrible experience. Also, they could do better on cleanliness.

Service is always terrible here. Sometimes it the food is good enough, bad service won't keep me away (eg. Buffalo Wild Wings). But this service is bad enough to keep me away. It's a shame. Their thick cut fries are so good. Only once have I had decent service here. Most of the time, my waiters are either rude, slow, or just don't care about their job.
Really like coming here with the family always Amazing don't forget your Red Ronin Reward Card!
What a pleasure. This place is excellent for friend gathering and stacking up on food. The unlimited fries are delectable and awesome. Burgers are always great.

The food was slow but tasted ok. The problem was the overcharge--I had a double burger, my wife ordered the smallest burger available, and they brought both 20 min after ordering (which took 10 min to get help). Food was ok, warm, good taste. Fries very good but portion small. The reason for the low rating came with the bill--my meal was $7.99 and my wife's "smallest burger in the house" was $8.79?  We brought this discrepancy up to the waiter, and only got a shrug. We brought it up to the manager on duty "Drew" and got the same shrug with a weak excuse of "we take a normal size burger price and take a $1 off"...except my double was 80 cents cheaper than her "cheapest burger in the house. I'm calling the manager "Chris" to see if he can't manage, but I most likely won't be back. Not worth the money for this kind of service!!!

We went there yesterday for burgers. I got a whiskey BBQ something, ate half of it and have been spending my whole Saturday in bed due to food poisoning. We had dinner there and the poison started at 4am so we know for sure it is that burger.  My husband is ok since he ordered something different. This is just so bad!!! Not sure what they put in their food!

We decided to go to Red Robin for a burger since I had been craving one for a couple of days. Big freaking mistake! Dylan was our waiter if you can call him that. No smile, no how was your food, nothing. I should have read recent before going there. We got seated immediately since they weren't busy at all. Took a while for our waiter to come over to even take our order. We got water to drink so that wasn't a big deal and it came out in a reasonable amount of time. I was so hungry and was looking forward to my burger. Well, about close to 30 minutes later I was getting pretty angry and looked at the shelf that was next to the booth that we were in and saw dust all down it. I was  going to talk to the manager about it but my Husband told me not to.  Then the food came. We had no silverware or napkins and had  to flag another waitress to get them for us. She had them in her hand and walked by and didn't give them to us until she helped someone else. Then I was beyond pissed!!! We were ignored over and over. The machine where you pay your ticket was messed up so we had to flag hm down Again!!! Beyond terrible experience.  We will think twice before coming back. Don't go here unless absolutely necessary or until management changes hands. Awful.
Tried the Clucks and Fries, buffalo style. Was tasty, but nothing amazing. Be sure to sign up for the Loyalty club to get a free hamburger in the month of your birthday.

After waiting about 20 minutes we finally decided to leave. They have no air conditioning, they couldn't seat because they didn't have a server, and didn't even offer us any water. It was hotter in thethere than it was outside. Look at Applebee's here we come

This place is always hit or miss, but this time it was great. Our server was great and interacted with the kids. He was attentive without being intrusive. He was in a great mood, and it showed. At several times in the evening, my kids would catch him dancing as he served dinners, or cleaned off tables.  The food was good and cooked the way we wanted., and the drinks and fries never stopped coming. It was a definite hit,and it was the reason we will be going back again.

Contacted by someone from Red Robin...issued a $15 gift card as an "apology" for their service. Not that I expected anything, but realistically, a simple "I'm sorry, the situation has been taken care of" would have come across better than issuing a $15 gift card on a $73 check. That's like giving someone a $5 gift card to a department store--completely pointless since they'd have to spend more than the "gift" in order to use it. haha!

This place used to be hip and the food used to taste good. But recently I went in here to eat and all I saw were old and fat people everywhere. The food was a bit greasy and it took almost 45 minutes to get our food.

By far the worst.  I didn't even get a chance to eat here. This was going to be my first time eating at the praised "Red Robin." I had a party of just 3 people. 45 min before closing and they denied my business.  Will never eat at place when I am kicked out before I even order.  Horrible experience. Horrible staff. Just plain horrible management.

Sat in the bar. VERY dirty. Service was good but one of the bartenders behind the bar was brushing her teeth while mixing several drinks and talking to other staff. Yes you read that correctly, brushing her teeth! Didn't seem to be any managers around based on the incredible lack of cleanliness, hygiene, and professionalism. Men's bathroom had paper towels and toilet paper all over the floors. We will never go back, but maybe the health department should.
This a $14.00 burger??? Service was slow... I would recommend the Red Robin at the Mall... Or Northridge,CA... It's a shame and I think RR started in this state.

OMG Funny. Liars can be managers. After waiting a long time, our burgers came out cool or okay warm. The lettuce was like canned spinach. I was asked how the food was I asked If they blanch or boil or used some new canned lettuce. The manager said the lettuce is supposed to be blanched.  Haha Really Federal Way? Boo hiss for lying to a culinary professional.

We were seated at the booth right behind the hostess station and the stench of urine on the carpet was overwhelming.  Somebody in that organization needs to have their sense of smell checked. We left without placing our order.  Absolutely disgusting.

Great place to come if you're craving a burger and especially if you're craving fries! We came here around 9:10pm before they closed and got seated right away. It's a little dark in the restaurant for being in a casual setting. I couldn't really read the menus because of the lighting. All the burgers are good! Each one has its own unique taste to it. Unlike other burger joints, some just taste like straight beef with no flavor. Burgers are at great prices. Their bottomless Freckled Lemonade is so refreshing! Their Blue Moon Shakes are amazing!!

So it was lunch time one Saturday and we decided to go to Red Robin. We usually go to the one in Des Moines or the Auburn one by the Supermall. But unfortunately we somehow decided to go here. The restaurant is terrible. I know this isn't the restaurant's fault, but it seems like this is the place where stressed, inexperienced, new mothers come to get a drink with their crying children. But the reason the restaurant ACTUALLY sucks is the cleanliness of the place. After a huge group of people left, some kid who kept running around and climbing on tables left his BBQ stained napkin on the floor. So fifteen minutes after they left, the minimum wage 16 year old still didn't pick up the floor. We had to use chairs to block our sight of the floor because it was just too disgusting. The person I went with had ordered an avocado croissant sandwich. Well it had no avocado, no mayo, no mustard, only ham, lettuce, and tomatoes. Turns out she got someone else's meal. The manager delivered the actual avocado sandwich, and while he was here she asked him how often they clean their floors. Prepare yourself. ONCE A MONTH! Disgusting. The only reason this place has two stars is because of our waitress that we weren't supposed to get, Denise. If the owner or manager or whoever is in charge is reading this, THIS WOMAN NEEDS TO RUN THIS PLACE. She was absolutely the best waiter I have ever had. She is so friendly and so kind. Took great care of us. Her alone gave this place that 2 star instead of 1. And with that, my review is done.

This is the worst red robin I have ever been too. They are so slow and rude. I don't understand how customer service is really this bad. But food tastes the same as other locations. So if you don't care about service go in for the food.

I've been to Red Robin more than any man should have gone. But I go there anyways, and I have to say that my recent visit was amazing. This was the only visit that was this great. It was at a mellow time, so it was not as busy.  My waitress, Aubrey has to take the cake for this review. She was on top of everything. She was serving 3 tables at the time, but was on her toes the whole time. When our burgers came in, I'd let her know that we will finish our fries pretty fast, so she actually grabbed two fries trays right after she left.  She was on top of the drinks, questions, and everything. She got us a bigger size fry sauce when she saw us getting low on our sauces. Basically she was the top notch waitress. I couldnt ask for a better server.  Reason for a 4 and not a 5 is because the Red Robin always smells like dirty rag. I've been here a lot and every other red robin in my area, but this one seems to never get rid of the dirty rag smell. Sad, but server was amazing.

This place has really good fatty fun foods. They have also become pretty creative with their drinks such as the hard root beer floats. 3 stars because the wait can be incredibly long, but if you are a party of 2 and going to the bar area the waiting is really short.
